column5: My brother in law doesn't have a credit card. Is there a place he can go to write it, any day of the week, to get his license? He lives in London.
I think it was Boaters Exam that had their tent set up outside Canadian Tire last weekend in Midland. Check out their website and see if they are doing on site tests elsewhere..
Bass pro has had a test centre at their store. I know it's not close, but if he was heading up for a trip it could be an option. That is if you meant London Ontario.
They were set up outside Cdn Tire in Barrie today.  He should call the Candadian tire stores in London
Thanks for the info! If you learn something more I'd appreciate that too.

I'm pretty sure most ministry or transportation offices have boat exams available. I got mine while at the beer store last long weekend... Still swear I couldn't have came even close to passing... But w/e $60 bucks later and I have my boat licence for life (or so they say... )
You should be able to use your debit card on line.Thats how I did it.

Just go to bass pro on your way up north...the test is a joke....it will take no more than 10 mintues to right....cost $60.00 for the joke lic....i did it in 8 minutes with out even looking at the book.
